alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Woods (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 4:10PM CDT until July 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Salt Fork Arkansas River near Alva affecting Alfalfa and Woods Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Salt Fork Arkansas River near Alva. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands to depths up to 2 feet occurs along the river in parts of northeastern Woods and northern Alfalfa counties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The Salt Fork Arkansas River is expected to rise to a crest of 12.8 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
